noun.description: A Celto-Germanic tribe inhabiting an area between the rivers Rhine and Schelde in northern Gaul (now Hainault, Belgium); the members of this tribe.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Richard Grenewey (fl. 1598), translator. From classical Latin Nerviī (plural), the name of a Celto-Germanic tribe in the northern part of ancient Gaul.
